summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting the declination to prosecute Federal Bureau of Prisons employees Tova Noel and Michael Thomas regarding false certifications and statements made during the OIG investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York decided not to prosecute after consultation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate whose death is the subject of the OIG investigation. Referenced by his register number 76318-054.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: BOP employee who allegedly made false certifications and false statements during the OIG investigation into Epstein's death. Subject of the declination to prosecute.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: BOP employee (Lieutenant, Senior Officer, Material Handler Supervisor) who allegedly made false certifications and false statements during the OIG investigation into Epstein's death. Subject of the declination to prosecute.

connections.description: Both were BOP employees at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and subjects of the same OIG investigation regarding false statements about Epstein's death.
Noel was a correctional officer at the facility where Epstein was held as an inmate.
Thomas was a BOP lieutenant/supervisor at the facility where Epstein was held as an inmate.

events.title: OIG-AUSA Consultation on Prosecution
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from DOJ OIG spoke with an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from SDNY regarding investigative findings about alleged false certifications and statements by BOP employees in the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Declination to Prosecute Decision
events.description: AUSA advised that after consulting with the USAO SDNY supervisor of the Public Corruption Unit, it was determined that the USAO SDNY would not prosecute BOP employees Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Memorandum Finalization
events.description: The declination memorandum was digitally signed and finalized by a Senior Special Agent and an Assistant Special Agent in Charge.
personsInvolved: Unnamed Assistant Special Agent in Charge

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG Reporting Office)
Southern District of New York (USAO jurisdiction)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York declined to prosecute BOP employees Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for alleged false certifications and statements made during the OIG investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The decision not to prosecute was made after consultation with the supervisor of the Public Corruption Unit at the USAO SDNY on September 21, 2021.
The investigation focused on the circumstances surrounding the death of former BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054).
The document is an internal DOJ OIG memorandum that contains neither recommendations nor conclusions and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
The document reveals that an OIG investigation into Epstein's death uncovered alleged misconduct by BOP staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
